intro: Biscutella balearia, commonly known as the Balearic biscuitroot, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and appear in clusters during the spring. Biscutella balearia is adapted to arid environments and has a limited distribution, primarily found on the Balearic Islands and parts of southern Europe.
